title: Epesri capsules not showing on Analyse page
body: We have had an email from a user: >Hi there, just noticed that Epesri has disappeared from your data when I tried to use your analyse tool. I have checked, and can't find Epesri on the site. However, when checking BQ, the data appears to be there: Is this possibly related to #3746 , and there has been an import issue?

title: Dexcom One data not showing in practice measures
body: @brianmackenna noted that Dexcom One sensors weren't appearing in the [Continuous Blood Glucose Monitoring](https://openprescribing.net/measure/cgm_sensors/national/england/) measure. This measure had [recently been updated to use VMP and AMP codes](https://github.com/ebmdatalab/openprescribing/commit/abf832d1803e3c63e53ca8926bce83e426d4265f) to identify. Other CGM devices are showing. On investigation in BQ, the code used in the measure was shown to correctly identify Dexcom One: ``` SELECT bnf_code, nm FROM dmd.vmp WHERE id = 34865511000001109 -- selects bnf_codes from vmp table matching VMP id \n", UNION DISTINCT -- joins vmp and amp tables together \n", SELECT bnf_code, nm FROM dmd.amp WHERE vmp = 34865511000001109 AND bnf_code IS NOT NULL-- selects bnf_codes from amp table matching VMP id where they exist ``` Further to that, code was run in BQ to find prescribing at a local practice, in order to mirror the measure data: ``` select bnf_name, p.bnf_code, SUM(items) as items from hscic.normalised_prescribing p INNER JOIN (SELECT bnf_code FROM dmd.vmp WHERE id = 34865511000001109 -- selects bnf_codes from vmp table matching VMP id \n", UNION DISTINCT -- joins vmp and amp tables together \n", SELECT bnf_code FROM dmd.amp WHERE vmp = 34865511000001109 AND bnf_code IS NOT NULL) bnf -- selects bnf_codes from amp table matching VMP id where they exist \n", ON p.bnf_code = bnf.bnf_code WHERE month between '2022-06-01' and '2022-08-01' and p.bnf_code LIKE '2148000010%' and practice = 'L83083' group by bnf_name, bnf_code ``` Result: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18683239/200186968-7aa3a945-115e-4a89-8bd3-aa44107f6e61.png) This compares with the measures page on OpenPrescribing, where Dexcom One is missing from the preparations breakdown. Running the code below also shows that the data does not match the total quantities: ``` select month, SUM(quantity) as quantity, SUM(items) as items from hscic.normalised_prescribing p INNER JOIN (SELECT bnf_code FROM dmd.vmp WHERE id = 34865511000001109 -- selects bnf_codes from vmp table matching VMP id \n", UNION DISTINCT -- joins vmp and amp tables together \n", SELECT bnf_code FROM dmd.amp WHERE vmp = 34865511000001109 AND bnf_code IS NOT NULL) bnf -- selects bnf_codes from amp table matching VMP id where they exist \n", ON p.bnf_code = bnf.bnf_code WHERE month between '2022-06-01' and '2022-08-01' and p.bnf_code LIKE '2148000010%' and practice = 'L83083' group by month order by month ``` Result: compared with In summary, the website is showing different results to the same SQL ran in BQ

title: Youtube Video Front Page
body:
The video on the front page is broken. It's not a video owned by the DataLab account - I think it's probably held in @Bengoldacre account but it doesn't appear on youtube search. 

https://www.youtube.com/embed/U-hvuEfUUOM

It was a very old video so maybe best to remove it until we make a new video?

title: Oragnisation Hierachy bug PCN ->CCG
body:
On an STP page ([south east London example](https://openprescribing.net/stp/E54000030/)) the STP says there are "x PCNs in this STP". This should read CCG for hierachy, however when you click "show more" it does correctly show CCGs so it is just text that needs amending. 


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40460354/70218241-8a0ef700-173a-11ea-8898-47d4d40cc631.png)

title: dmd+d browser: supplier search
body:
I am trying to display all products from a supplier (in this case wockhardt). When I do the [search](https://openprescribing.net/dmd/advanced-search/amp/?search=%5B%22supp%22%2C%22equal%22%2C9301611000001104%5D) it returns zero products and the search criteria changes to "nothing" 

Colleagues at the BSA tell me this particular search is commonly requested by suppliers so they can identify all they AMPPs in the dm+d.

title: Opioids measure not showing correct presentations
body:
I'm not sure if this is related to #1794 but the list of presentations on https://openprescribing.net/measure/opioidome/ is incomplete - it only includes _generic_ preparations, not branded.

This may be due to the way that the ome table is structured, as only generic presentations are listed.

title: Bug on positive messages for cost savings for cost-related measures
body:
Following on from #1684.

 There seems to be a bug on practice pages in calculating "positive" messages.  For example in [Islington Cental](https://openprescribing.net/practice/F83010/measures/?tags=lowpriority) the prescribe no co proxamol ([link to measure](https://openprescribing.net/measure/lpcoprox/practice/F83010/)) so it should have a postive message like _By prescribing better than the median, this prctice has saved the NHS £xxxx over the past 6 months_

It seems to work ok on CCG pages see liothyronine [here](https://openprescribing.net/ccg/08H/measures/?tags=lowpriority)  and regions [here](https://openprescribing.net/regional-team/Y56/measures/?tags=lowpriority)

title: Presentation breakdown on some measures not working correctly
body:
When you click on the "Break the overall score down into individual presentations" link on some measures, it appears that not all presentations are shown.

1.  in the opioids OME measure (e.g. https://openprescribing.net/ccg/99P/opioidome/) when you click on the [link](https://openprescribing.net/measure/opioidome/ccg/99P/) the list is not correct.  For example, there are no branded preparations showing.

2.  It would also be useful if, for the OME measure, the list is not sorted by items or quantity, but instead have OME, as this is more relevance for the measure.  The items at the top of the list tend to be low dose, and therefore not as relevant as some of the presentations lower down.

title: Menu dropdowns are broken on tariff viewer
body:
The JS powered dropdowns in the main menu bar don't work on https://openprescribing.net/tariff/

I'm assuming this is due to the JS error that gets thrown:
```
openprescribing.min.js:1 Uncaught Highcharts error #16: www.highcharts.com/errors/16
```
but I haven't investigated this yet.

title: Practice search page hangs on mobile
body:
https://openprescribing.net/practice/

Works fine on the desktop site, but on mobile freezes for about a minute after the first two characters are entered into the search bar, then returns to normal and seems to search fine after that.

body:
Home page grey bar is in the wrong position:

title: List more than one generic product for PPU formulation swaps
body:
We only list one product as being prescribed generically when we have an item with a formulation swap e.g. 
https://openprescribing.net/ccg/06Y/0403040W0AAAEAE/price_per_unit/?date=2017-06-01
This lists Venlafaxine_Cap 150mg M/R as generic, but isn't listing Venlafaxine_tab 150mg M/R

If you go to the page for the tabs: https://openprescribing.net/ccg/06Y/0403040W0AAAKAK/price_per_unit/?date=2017-06-01 it still lists only the caps as generic

title: Fix cost-saving measures
body:
There is a problem with the way price savings are being calculated at GP Practice level for some(?) of our cost-saving measures

Example: Keppra
A user got in touch with us to say that on the [GP Practice dashboard](https://openprescribing.net/practice/Y02811/) the keppra measure says 

> 'This practice was at the **32nd percentile** on average across the past 6 months. If it had prescribed in line with the median, this practice would have **spent £98.36 less** over the past 6 months. If it had prescribed in line with the best 10%, it would have spent £330.67 less.'

If you look at Keppra across the whole of the CCG, some practices below the median have the correct text ("this practice has saved the NHS") but others have the incorrect text ("this practice would have spent X less")

When looking at this, I noticed that the deciles on the practice pages aren't the same as the deciles we use on the CCG pages. This might be what is causing the problem. The median for Keppra at CCG level in May is 12.2%, and at practice dashboard level it is 6.7%.

title: Make Manchester CCG Measures have the same start date as other CCGs
body:
Manchester CCG measures have a different start date to other CCGs:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15875191/28364126-20d4aac6-6c7b-11e7-874f-0e27025506fc.png)

Some measures go back to 2010 - I'm not sure if this is intended, I thought we were showing past 5 years. It isn't consistent though
e.g. [KTT9](https://openprescribing.net/measure/ktt9_cephalosporins/) is August 2010
[Diltiazem](https://openprescribing.net/measure/diltiazem/) is September 2011

On both of these pages Manchester goes back to June 2012, so it might be that Manchester is the only CCG working correctly

title: Stop Central Manchester CCG appearing in Analyse Search Results
body:
Central Manchester appears in analyse search results. The dates it appears in differs e.g.

In [this search](https://openprescribing.net/analyse/#org=CCG&numIds=0703021Q0BB&denomIds=0703021Q0&selectedTab=summary) you can see it from Feb 16 - current

In [this search](https://openprescribing.net/analyse/#org=CCG&numIds=0212000AA&denomIds=2.12&selectedTab=summary) it appears from Nov 16 - current 

(Note: dates above refer to it appearing with no numerator data (so no bar), it might be visible with data in other months. I can't search with Central Manchester as the CCG - which is good - but it means I can't highlight in pink to find easily)

title: Only include April 2013 data onwards in CCG downloads from Analyse page
body:
CCG downloads include data from 2012. This is most obvious when downloading data with total list size as the denominator, because it adds a list size of 0. Data for CCGs should be from April 2013 onwards

e.g.
https://openprescribing.net/analyse/#org=CCG&orgIds=03N&numIds=0401010AD&denom=total_list_size&selectedTab=summary

title: Make file names shorter for downloads of long searches on Analyse page
body: File names for long searches are too long to open in Excel e.g. https://openprescribing.net/analyse/#org=CCG&orgIds=01Y&numIds=090402000BBQLA0,090402000BBRBA0,090402000BBRAA0,090402000BBQKA0,090402000BBQMA0&denomIds=9.4.2&selectedTab=chart

body: If you go to a URL that doesn't exist (e.g openprescribing.net/trends) the More & Trends dropdowns don't work. Probably similar to #386

body: Update this https://github.com/ebmdatalab/openprescribing/blob/master/openprescribing/frontend/management/commands/measure_definitions/sildenafil.json#L19 to true

title: Fix 'More' and 'Trends' Dropdown on measure page
body:
The more & trends dropdowns don't work on https://openprescribing.net/measure/

I think there are other examples of pages on the site where this doesn't work, will add as I find them.

title: Fix date issues on analyse chart
body:
There are two problems with the analyse search results related to date:

- Search by 'practices or practice:' Date slider allows you to go back to October 2010 (rather than August 2010). No data shows up for October 2010 - January 2012

- Search by 'CCG or CCGs': Date slider allows you to go back to February 2012, CCGs weren't formed until April 2013. 

This also causes a problem on the 'show over time' graphs:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15875191/24497785/770ddc94-1534-11e7-9df1-26a4828d1889.png)

Might be linked to #70

title: Zooming in on OpenPrescribing logo on charts takes you to Highcharts
body: If you zoom in on a graph & end your click on the 'openprescribing.net' logo you get taken to highcharts.com instead of zooming

title: Date slider does not update maps on analyse page
body:
From user on doorbell: 

The ``analyseMap.updateMap`` function [has the signature](https://github.com/ebmdatalab/openprescribing/blob/master/openprescribing/media/js/src/map.js#L142) 
``function(ratio, options)``. 

The ``analyseMap.update`` function [makes the incorrect call](https://github.com/ebmdatalab/openprescribing/blob/master/openprescribing/media/js/src/map.js#L10) 
``this.updateMap('ratio_' + ratio, month, title, subtitle);``., resulting in a TypeError when [the line](https://github.com/ebmdatalab/openprescribing/blob/master/openprescribing/media/js/src/map.js#L144) 
``var month = options.activeMonth.replace(/\//g, '-');`` is reached. 

Consequently, adjusting the date slider on a map view fails to update the map. Misleading, the subtitle (e.g. "in Apr '13") is updated, despite neither the colors of the polygons nor the date in the legend box being updated.

title: Trends bars don't show information when hovering over
body:
Trends bar charts are no longer showing extra information when hovering over them - probably caused by crosshair mouse pointer change.

e.g. https://openprescribing.net/bnf/01/

title: Alert email text for DOACs needs updating
body:
Feedback from user:

"By prescribing DOACs we are implementing NICE Technology Appraisals – which we should be doing. High Spend in this area is as a result of anticogulating people with AF at high risk of stroke. Please don’t describe this as a bad thing (‘worst’) – it’s just that everyone else needs to catch up. "

title: Allow users to search by GP Practice Code in the GP Practice Dashboard Search
body:
The GP Practice search currently states you can search by practice name or code, but searching by code does not work
https://openprescribing.net/practice/

This search does allow you to search by postcode - so a quick fix to this will be to change the search text to say 'Search by name or postcode' instead of 'Search by name or code'

Use Case:
As community manager, I want to be able to search by GP Practice code when looking at practice dashboards so that I don't have to google the practice name if all the information I have is the code

title: Change openprescribing.net/caution so it doesn't redirect to RocketChat
body:
Typing in openprescribing.net/caution directs you to the rocket chat rather than to openprescribing. Not sure if this is happening on other links, I tried openprescribing.net/analyse and openprescribing.net/ccg and they both went to the right page

www.openprescribing.net/caution goes to the right place, and so does https://openprescribing.net  - seems to be http:// that is the problem

Tried it on chrome and firefox

title: Submit button on analyse page should not show "Fetching data" on error
body:
If an error is made on analyse, the site makes it look as though you have to refresh the whole page to redo the analysis (and therefore type everything in again):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15875191/18746304/7b480664-80be-11e6-9647-8d421bc4ea2b.png)

You can get around this by clicking into one of the text boxes, and after a few seconds it will change from saying 'fetching the data' to 'show me the data' but this isn't obvious unless you already know!

title: £ sign showing on Analyse 'Show over Time' graph
body:
If you hit the 'spending' button on the 'Show Summary'  results tab in the Analyse section, and then select the 'over time' graph, the items will be listed as £'s even though it is showing items not spend.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15875191/18432574/a2965c7a-78da-11e6-93f8-d689bed89226.png)

The text on the tooltip does say it is showing items, it is only the '£' that is incorrect. Can't send a link for it as it works fine if you link to it!

title: Drop-down menu items not working on dashboard pages
body:
https://openprescribing.net/ccg/99P/

None of the drop-down menu links appear when hovering over / clicking on "Trends" or "More" (on Chrome/OSX).

I think this is a relatively visible and therefore high-priority issue.

title: Don't reject presentations with BNF codes shorter than 15 chars
body:
In our `import_bnf_codes` script we reject presentations with BNF codes that are shorter than 15 chars. 

However, some devices seem to have presentation codes of less than 15 chars. For example:

21010220113    Flutter Oscillating Positive Expiratory Pressure Dev  
21010220114   Acapella Oscillating Positive Expiratory Pressure Dev   

These are legitimate so we should not exclude them.

title: Fix design of BNF charts with sparse data
body:
This sort of chart isn't helpful: 

https://openprescribing.net/chemical/0604012V0

Either return a bunch of zeroes in the data, or (better?) hard-code the x-axis to start at August 2010 and end at the current date.

title: Remove list sizes pre-2013 for CCGs
body:
At least until we figure out a way to backfill presentation/chemical data for CCGs pre-2013. 

This is because while we have list size data for the period, but no prescribing data, the graphs show misleading/unhelpful trends.  

For example: 
https://openprescribing.net/analyse/#org=CCG&numIds=0205051I0&denom=total_list_size&selectedTab=chart

And https://openprescribing.net/ccg/11E/ - the antibiotics charts look broken. 

I think the best way to get around this is simply to remove the list size data from the database.

title: Fix "%" axis labels for measures
body:
In the new beta measures pages, some measures are percentage-based. We seem to be dividing these by 100 incorrectly in the client - the % values are all too small. 

Investigate and fix.
